revised_title: Investigation of the Hydrolysis of Methyl Halides and its Implications
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the uncatalyzed hydrolysis of methyl halides and found that the energy of activation for these reactions is much higher than previously thought. They also discovered that the temperature coefficient of the apparent energy of activation is as great as for other simple uncatalyzed hydrolyses. This suggests that the reaction mechanism involves the participation of many bonds and extramolecular effects, such as the rotation of solute molecules in their solvent envelopes.
